doc.previous: Seattle has three major men's professional sports teams: the National Football League's Seattle Seahawks, Major League Baseball's Seattle Mariners, and Major League Soccer's Seattle Sounders FC. Other professional sports teams include the 2004 and 2010 Women's National Basketball Association champions, Seattle Storm.[182] The Seahawks' CenturyLink Field has hosted playoff games in 2006, 2008, 2011 and 2014. The Seattle Seahawks have advanced to the Super Bowl three times (2005, 2013 and 2014 seasons. They won the Super Bowl title in the 2013â2014 season and lost against the New England Patriots in Super Bowl XLIX. The Seattle Sounders FC began play in Major League Soccer in 2009,[183] and also play at CenturyLink Field.
doc.after: Seattle's professional sports history began at the start of the 20th century with the PCHA's Seattle Metropolitans, which in 1917 became the first American hockey team to win the Stanley Cup.[184] Seattle was also home to a previous Major League Baseball franchise in 1969: the Seattle Pilots. The team relocated to Milwaukee, Wisconsin and became the Milwaukee Brewers in 1970. From 1967 to 2008 Seattle was also home to an NBA franchise: the Seattle SuperSonics, who were the 1978â79 NBA champions. The team relocated to Oklahoma City, Oklahoma and became the Oklahoma City Thunder for the 2008-09 NBA season.[185]
